Package me.mthw.forge.cracker.ZIP

Class BruteCrackerZIP

java.lang.Object
me.mthw.forge.cracker.BruteCracker
me.mthw.forge.cracker.ZIP.BruteCrackerZIP
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class BruteCrackerZIP extends BruteCracker
The BruteCrackerZIP class is responsible for performing brute-force password cracking on ZIP files. It supports both ZipCrypto and AES encryption methods (AES-128, AES-192, AES-256). The class extends the BruteCracker base class and provides functionality to verify passwords, decrypt files, and clean up resources. Key features of this class include: - Support for multiple encryption methods used in ZIP files. - Verification of passwords against the encryption method. - Decryption of files once the correct password is found. - Resource management to ensure proper cleanup of allocated resources. Exceptions: - IllegalArgumentException is thrown if an unsupported encryption method is provided. - GeneralSecurityException is thrown for errors during password verification. - IOException and TskCoreException may be thrown during file decryption.
See Also:

  • ZIPVerifierAES

    • verifyPassword

      protected boolean verifyPassword(String password) throws GeneralSecurityException
      Verifies the provided password against the encryption method used in the ZIP file.
      Specified by:
      verifyPassword in class BruteCracker
      Parameters:
      password - The password to be verified.
      Returns:
      true if the password is correct; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      GeneralSecurityException - If an error occurs during the verification process.

    • decryptFile

      public void decryptFile(String password) throws org.sleuthkit.datamodel.TskCoreException, org.sleuthkit.autopsy.casemodule.NoCurrentCaseException, IOException
      Decrypts a file from a ZIP archive using the provided password.
      Specified by:
      decryptFile in class BruteCracker
      Parameters:
      password - The password to decrypt the ZIP file.
      Throws:
      org.sleuthkit.datamodel.TskCoreException - If an error occurs during the decryption process.
      org.sleuthkit.autopsy.casemodule.NoCurrentCaseException - If there is no current case context available. This method uses the provided password to open the ZIP file and extract a specific file. The extracted file is saved to a module directory. If the decryption is successful, the existing derived file is edited for new path to the case context. Any exceptions during the extraction process are caught and logged.
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while accessing the file.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the cracker.

      getName in class BruteCracker
      Returns:
      A string representing the name of the cracker, in this case "PDF Cracker".

    • clean

      public void clean()
      Cleans up resources used by the BruteCrackerZIP instance. This method ensures that any allocated resources for the zipCryptoVerifier and zipAESVerifier are properly released. It checks if these verifiers are not null before invoking their respective clean methods.
      Overrides:
      clean in class BruteCracker

      Edits a derived file in the case database after it has been decrypted. Adds correct path for decrypted file.
      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      decryptedFile - The decrypted file to be added as a derived file.
